result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

02:25 PM Defendant DWIGHT D. PERRY in court with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  David C. Rashid appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Information on file.  Defense acknowledges receipt of information and waives reading.  Noting a special appearance and enters a not guilty plea.  Court notes victim's rights are complied with.  Court orders bond to continue.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 20, 2022 at 10:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for June 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.

No contact with V1, V2 OR V3 in WCSO 21-4396.   Absolute sobriety.  No possession or consumption of controlled substances or drug paraphernalia without a valid prescription.  Comply with the Drug Free 24/7 Program. If you violate the rules of 24/7, your bond is immediately revoked and you will be jailed until such time as you can be brought before the court for a bond review hearing.  You shall report for fingerprinting and photos pursuant to Wis Stats 970.02(7) to room 15, lower level of the Courthouse.  Due to COVID-19 you will need to call 920-236-4906 BEFORE reporting.  Defendant does acknowledge they've been advised who the victim(s) is/are.

10:35 AM Defendant DWIGHT D. PERRY in court with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Defendant DWIGHT D. PERRY in custody.  Tucker T. Tellefson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  DWIGHT D. PERRY appeared by video means with Attorney.  Joint request for bond to be amended to a $500 cash bond w/the same conditions.  The Court will amend bond to $500 cash with the same conditions.  The Court notes there is no victim present that wishes to make a statement.  Record closed @ 10:40.  Arraignment scheduled for April 20, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
